Description: Floor sherd from East Greek pottery plate, thickening towards the outer edge; underside plain, with five groups of plastic ridges preserved; interior, thin reddish glaze.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For similar ridges see the unglazed substantial shallow bowl, British Museum 1888,0601.608a-b.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 239, no. 259)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.530)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5987 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
